result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Dupree Tatum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting An Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work and treatment.
Sign up for probation  no later than 10/7/22.

miscConds.notes:
No violent contact with T.J.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

Submit a DNA sample by 10/7/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
Pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travis Dupree Tatum

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Travis Dupree Tatum in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Travis Dupree Tatum.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded. Court finds victim notification has been complied with. Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 1 day time served, Huber Privileges for work and treatment. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/07/22.
- No violent contact with TJ.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant Travis Dupree Tatum in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for plea and sentencing hearing.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Travis Dupree Tatum in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Flynn requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court vacated the No Contact Order as to P.T.  Court modified the the No Contact Order to a NO VIOLENT CONTACT ORDER as to T.J.

Defendant Travis Dupree Tatum in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case remains set for status conference on 6/14/22 at 9:30.

Defendant Travis Dupree Tatum in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Flynn has received discovery and would like time to review it.  Atty. Flynn also requests a bail hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TJ and PTT.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Travis Dupree Tatum in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 1 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/14/22 @ 2P
